decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Dredge creatures and cards through a combination of discard outlets and self-mill effects. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting, Careful Study, and Breakthrough, the deck aims to bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba, Ichorid, and Golgari Grave-Troll from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy play key roles in generating zombies and disrupting the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck seeks to create a fast and powerful graveyard-based combo to win the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. It utilizes cards like "Terminus" to sweep the board, "Snapcaster Mage" to reuse spells, and "Jace, the Mind Sculptor" for card advantage. The deck also includes cards like "Back to Basics" to disrupt mana bases and "Swords to Plowshares" for removal. With a mix of control elements and card advantage, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures and use mana acceleration to overwhelm the opponent with big threats. By utilizing lands like Cloudpost and Eldrazi Temple, as well as mana rocks like Grim Monolith, the deck aims to cast creatures like Endbringer, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher ahead of the curve. Cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust provide disruption and protection for your creatures, while Karn, Scion of Urza offers card advantage and a win condition. The deck aims to win through early aggression and overwhelming board presence.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with key cards like Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Cabal Therapy. By dredging through the deck and bringing back creatures like Ichorid and Golgari Grave-Troll, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and powerful creature plays. The deck also includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana and Faithless Looting for card advantage, making it a potent combo deck in the Legacy format.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing mana acceleration to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Chalice of the Void and Wasteland helps control the opponent's resources, while cards like Eye of Ugin and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide powerful late-game threats. The deck's aggressive strategy is supported by a variety of land cards that enable efficient mana production for casting game-winning Eldrazi creatures.

This Elves combo deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while generating card advantage with Glimpse of Nature. The goal is to use cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to tutor and play powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. Cards like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger provide synergies with the Elves, allowing for untaps and additional activations. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and explosive combo while maintaining board presence and card advantage.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler. The deck focuses on generating card advantage with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Baleful Strix, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card selection spells, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slow and controlling manner.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Daze, Stifle, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will. It aims to control the board with small but efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, backed up by removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler to close out the game quickly. The mana base is designed to support all three colors efficiently, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through fast mana sources like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, in order to cast multiple spells in the same turn and effectively win the game with a storm count high enough to use Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage. The deck also includes disruption like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to interact with the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Past in Flames and Infernal Tutor allows for additional flexibility and consistency in executing the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana accelerants like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, dig through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, disrupt the opponent's hand with Thoughtseize and Duress, and ultimately win the game by casting a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony. The deck aims to efficiently assemble and execute its combo while maintaining the ability to interact with the opponent's game plan through disruption spells.

This combo-reanimator deck aims to quickly get powerful creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield, bypassing their mana costs. Key cards like Entomb and Reanimate allow for fast graveyard manipulation and big creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria are brought back to play with Animate Dead and Exhume. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and clear the way for the reanimation combo to succeed. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats before they can establish their own game plan.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and counterspells. The deck utilizes powerful control cards such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to generate card advantage and control the board. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of threats like Baleful Strix and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure while maintaining control of the game. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck aims to control the game by countering threats with Force of Will, removing creatures with Diabolic Edict and Kolaghan's Command, and gaining card advantage with Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base provides flexibility and consistency in casting spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures by using lands like Cloudpost and Ancient Tomb. It aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Sorcerous Spyglass and Chalice of the Void while controlling the board with creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Endbringer. Additionally, it can quickly generate mana using Grim Monolith and use powerful finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Karn, Scion of Urza for card advantage and All Is Dust for board wipes.

This combo deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's entire library. It includes cards like Imperial Recruiter and Goblin Welder to search for combo pieces and protect the combo. It also runs disruption in the form of Red Elemental Blast and Pyroblast to protect against counterspells. Ethersworn Canonist slows down opponent's spell casting, while cards like Walking Ballista and Engineered Explosives provide additional removal options. The deck aims to control the game and win quickly with the combo while disrupting opponent's strategies.

The deck aims to quickly develop a strong board presence using cheap spells and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. It disrupts opponents' strategies through countermagic like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Stifle, while also using Wasteland to disrupt their mana base. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to consistently apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan, aiming to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.
